text: Ten-ball is a pool game similar to nine-ball. It is played with ten balls instead of nine, and with the 10 ball instead of the 9 as the "". The game was made in the early 1960s. Its popularity has risen since the early 2000s as nine-ball has flaws with it's break. The World Pool-Billiard Association (WPA) rules for ten-ball are similar to those for nine-ball, but with key changes to increase the difficulty of the game. In contrast to nine-ball, it is slightly harder to any balls on the with all shots being . Ten-ball is preferred over nine-ball by some professionals as a more challenging discipline than nine- ball. ==References== == Further reading == * * * * * Category:Pool (cue sports)
title: Ten-ball
